reporting-org.narrative: UTZ - joined forces with Rainforest Alliance

title.narrative: Building capacities for sector change: country program Ghana

description.narrative: In 2020 we will have strengthened the lobby and advocacy capacity of civil society organizations in Ghana on productivity, farmer group strengthening, gender and child labor. As a result we will see an improvement of policy environment (both government and companies) and support services in these countries related to these themes. These themes are: 1. Sustainable productivity Raising smallholder productivity in a sustainable way is a key component of sector transformation. It is needed to increase income of the farmer and increase production while lowering the environmental footprint. 2. Smallholder inclusion & farmer group strengthening The aim is to increase the inclusion of smallholders in supply-chain driven sustainability programs. Strengthening farmer organizations is seen as an important way to increase the bargaining power of smallholder farmers in the supply chain. 3. Women’s empowerment and gender The goal is to increase the inclusion of women in certification and access to benefits as well as to reduce discrimination and violence against women. 4. Child labor The focus is on prevention, monitoring and remediation of child labor.
SP-GHA Building capacities for sector change: country program Ghana

title.narrative: Country Scan

description.narrative: During the first part of the inception phase of the program (December 2015-March 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff, carried out a deeper analysis of the sector(s) and themes proposed for their countries to develop a more focused approach for the SP program. The objective of the Country Scans was “to provide a situational analysis on each sector and theme per country assessing the current state with regards to the relevant thematic SP objectives, clearly formulating the causes of the problem that need addressing and identify opportunities for interventions and provide recommendations on potential partners for these interventions.” The Country Scan documents are based on our own experience in the countries, but also document review, conversations/interviews with experts, key informants including Dutch embassy staff, national and international organizations, and workshop results with many of these actors.

title.narrative: # of country scans

comment.narrative: 1 country scan is completed for Ghana
10-01-2018: 1 country scan completed for Ghana

title.narrative: Country Plan

description.narrative: During the second part of the inception phase of the program (April-July 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff in drafting the country plans. The purpose of the SP country program plan is to set out a strategic direction for sector change in the country and serves as a framework. This plan clearly states UTZ goals for the country the Theory of Change to guide interventions as well as the budget for said activities. Overall, the SP Country Plan will serve as a guide for the next years, as well as a basis for the year plans that will be formulated for 2017 to 2020.

title.narrative: # of country plans

comment.narrative: 1 country plan is completed for Ghana
10-01-2018: 1 country plan completed for Ghana

title.narrative: Ultimate Outcome 1: Improved inclusion of the voice of female and male smallholders and workers

description.narrative: Improved inclusion of the voice of female and male smallholders and workers in policy/law-making processes

title.narrative: DD3 # of more inclusive policy/law-making processes

description.narrative: Voices, needs and interests of male and female farmers, smallholders and workers are better included in the development of policies and services

comment.narrative: 04-06-2019: 1. Cocobod engages with media about cocoa sustainability issues Concerns of farmers are voiced out in the media space 2 Cocobod is more receptive to meeting farmers to engage with them at the community level 3. Improved gender equity in CAA membership. Increased access to CAA services by female cocoa farmers discount on membership fee for all new CAA female farmers.

29-04-2020: 1) Cocoa Abrabopa Association has become more gender inclusive. Through gender trainings and CAA gender programs, more women are more active in decision making. There is increased in women participation in trainings and an increased interest for leadership roles. 2) A recent farmgate price dessimination workshop held in Kumasi and organised by SEND GH saw many women participating in the discussing the subject matter. Especially women from CAA & Kuapa Kokoo. 3)Cocoa farmers in BIA West District are now demanding COCOBOD to promote and make available more environmental-friendly pesticides. 4) COCOBOD now engage GARDJA in almost all conversations around cocoa setor.

29-04-2021: 1. Increase in females in leadership roles at the regional and council level in CAA structures. 2. 28 Community Monitors - trained by Ecocare - are involved with and lead their communities in the monitoring and collection of data on CFI implementation. 3. Production of a national report regarding implementation of CFI commitments in Ghana.

title.narrative: Ultimate Outcome 2: Policy changes & implementation

description.narrative: Policies are better in line with the needs of female and male farmers, smallholders and workers; Adequate implementation of policies;

title.narrative: DD1 # of ((inter)national) standards and policies implemented

description.narrative: Adequate implementation of policies

comment.narrative: 29-04-2019: 1. farmers have increased access to inputs and Farmers are able to use the inputs to facilitate productivity increas as a consequence of the CODAPEC policy. 2: 10% increase in female CAA members in possesion of land tenure documents

title.narrative: DD2 # of policy changes that UTZ /partners contributed to

description.narrative: Policies are better in line with the needs of (female) smallholders, (female) farmers and (female) farm workers, based on their needs and interests

comment.narrative: 29-04-2019: Comment: 1. Cocobod isseud new regulations reagarding deforestation in protected areas, RA steering comitee of CFI, giving input on this new regulation. 2: RA gave feedback on the government actionplans reagarding Child Labor

29-04-2020: 1) COCOBOD has increased the farmgate price. RA contributed through evidence generated (research) on cocoa pricing/ income, engagement with key actors and a Press Release 2) COCOBOD has changed it input distribution policy: farmers now access inputs directly through respective cooperative groups. Our partner WCFO (representing the cocoa farmers) contributed by building capacity of farmer group leaders and through dialogue with COCOBOD leadership
29-04-2021: 1. Cocobod has vowed in 2020 to flush out the influx of unauthorised pesticides within the cocoa sector and punish dealers of fake pesticides.

title.narrative: Baseline Report

description.narrative: The baseline provides an elaborate context-analysis per country, containing details about capacity of partners and the current state regarding the thematic goals for L&A. The baseline focuses on three main areas: a. Description of baseline situation of context and stakeholders b. Baseline of outcomes of ToC c. Capacities assessment

one per country
